title: Business Live: Weinstein leaves board - BBC News
summary: pound down bank deputy governor comments .
merlin shares plummet despite peppa pig plans .
unite welcomes airbus and bombardier deal .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining business live today .
we will be back on wednesday from 6.00am onwards when we will bring you all the breaking business and economics news , including the latest employment and wage growth figures .

documents.title: ibm beats forecasts
text: ibm has reported third quarter revenue ahead of expectations .
revenue rose to $ 19.2bn against forecasts of $ 18.6bn .

documents.title: us markets close
text: the dow jones industrial average finished within a whisker of 23,000 on tuesday .
although the index briefly surpassed that level , it settled at 22,997.24 after rising 40.28 points .
s & p 500 closed up 1.72 points at 2,559.36 .
the nasdaq closed marginally lower at 6,623.66 .

documents.title: breakingweinstein resigns from film company board
text: harvey weinstein has resigned from the board of the weinstein company .
the film producer was fired as chief executive on 8 october , however he remained on the board .
more than 40 women have now come forward with sexual assault allegations against mr weinstein .
mr weinstein has `` unequivocally denied '' any allegations of non-consensual relationships .
the weinstein company is in talks with colony capital to secure an injection of capital as well as potentially selling the film production and distribution business to the private equity firm .

documents.title: compare and contrastbbc brussels reporter adam fleming tweets
text: this is the document @ twitterid had in front of him yesterday .
comparison of eu/eea/wto etc
what are wto rules like for services ?
you do n't want to know .
i do .
main reason for asking tbh
was hoping for something from wto themselves ( without brexit spin in either direction ) .
i 'll find it myself .
then look up gats .
the main consequence in financial services is that uk firms lose passporting & have to reapply to each member state .
is it not the case that uk firms can avoid this by setting up ( small ) satellite units inside the eu ?
for example , some banks moving small groups ( 100 ppl or so ) .
unless eu cynically changes its rules they would then retain passporting , no ?
a question , adam : in english ?
because it 's the uk side that needs to understand the different models .
that is an eu centric view though .
here 's an alternative one
emergency break on fom is n't correct , it 's unilateral action but with political implications of invocation .
also the statement on not influencing eu , the reality is more nuanced for eea plus for global bodies uk would have full representation .
as it does now
uk currently a community member so of course but in the event we leave then different facts pertain .
only for eu harmonised issues , we have our own seat for non harmonised in eg codex
have you been to the unece website ?
have you noticed the individual eums cases ?
is `` deep & special partnership '' printed on the back page ?
just like to point out that @ twitterid made this chart in summer 2016
hurrah !
i was told it was publicly available but now you 've explained from where .
ta !

documents.title: nafta talks to run into 2018
text: talks between the us , mexico and canada over nafta will extend into 2018 .

the three countries said that significant disagreements remained and canadian foreign minister chrystia freeland , said : `` we 've also seen a series of unconventional proposals in critical areas of the negotiations that make our work much more challenging . ''

documents.title: 'silly ' to get stuck on eu budget point , says chancellor
text: chancellor philip hammond tells cnbc that the uk is `` absolutely ready to negotiate '' with the eu

`` the problem is the process that 's been laid down which says we ca n't start talking about the future and our future relationship until we 've settled the question of the budget contribution , '' he says .

`` what we 're saying is we can only settle that budget contribution question in the context of knowing what a future relationship is and this seems like a rather silly thing for us to get hung up on .
`` if we could just have a talk about this around a table i 'm pretty sure we 'll unstick it . ''

documents.title: banks 'want to stay in london '
text: chancellor philip hammond says that financial institutions want to stay in london post-brexit .
he tells cnbc : `` most of them intend to keep the vast majority of their staff in london and the bulk of their business in london .
`` eu business is only a fraction of london 's total business and we 're very confident that the uk , that london will remain a global financial centre . ''

documents.title: uk ready for all brexit scenarios , says hammond
text: chancellor philip hammond says the uk is prepared if it does n't reach a deal with the eu over brexit .

in an interview with cnbc , mr hammond says : `` our very strong preference is to do a deal with our european neighbours so that we go on working closely together , but of course we 're going to be prepared for the eventuality of not reaching a deal .
asked what that scenario would look like , he says : `` it looks like we have to be ready for a hard customs border , we have to be ready for tariffs on our trade .
`` we do n't think it is going to happen but we will be ready by march 2019 just in case that 's the outcome . ''

documents.title: social media data shared by spy agencies
text: uk spy agencies are collecting citizens ' social media and medical data , a court has heard .
the details emerged in a case brought by privacy international , looking at the legality of mass data collection .
it said it was concerned that the information could have been shared with foreign governments and corporate partners .
read the full story here .

documents.title: facebook hardware chief to leave
text: the head of facebook 's secretive hardware business - a slightly sinister sounding division called building 8 - is stepping down .
regina dugan , vice president of engineering , announced she is leaving `` to focus on building and leading a new endeavor '' .
she says it was a difficult decision but she was inspired by a quote by john f kennedy :
`` the world is very different now .
united , there is little we can not do divided , there is little we can do .
let us begin anew
`` and so , i begin , '' says ms dugan .
`` i will do my part . ''

documents.title: trump to make fed decision soon
text: us president donald trump has just said that he will make a decision over his choice for the us federal reserve chair `` over the next short period of time '' .
asked if he had a favorite on a list of five names - reported to include janet yellen , gary cohn , jerome powell , kevin warsh and john taylor - he said : `` honestly , i like them all . ''

documents.title: every cloud
text: on monday night , entertainment streaming giant netlfix reported better than expected third quarter results .
but on tuesday , its share price is trading 1.74 % lower at $ 199.15 .
still , it 's not all bad news .
netflix 's co-founder and chief executive reed hastings today joined forbes ' 2017 billionaires list for the first time .
as one of 22 new entrants , mr hastings squeaked past the $ 2bn cut-off point with a fortune of $ 2.2bn .

documents.title: a perfect storm for supermarkets
text: it 's hard to keep pace with the scale of cost-cutting and restructuring underway at britain 's biggest grocers .
they 're facing a perfect storm of rising costs and changing shopping habits .
and with the competition still cut throat from the discounters , they ca n't afford to recover those costs by putting up prices too much for the consumer .
sainsbury 's and its other main rivals are all trying to reduce operating costs and simplify their businesses to make them more efficient .
it 's a big , structural , shift and painful for all those affected .
author: Emma Simpson
Business correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: all part of the plan
text: since buying argos last year for £ 1.4bn , sainbury 's has been expanding the brand to ramp up competition against rivals such as online shopping giant amazon .
the supermarket group had set out a three-year plan to save £ 500m by march 2018 .
however , it has found another £ 500m of cost savings that could found over the following three years .

documents.title: sainsbury 's details job cuts
text: sainsbury 's is planning to cut 1,400 payroll and human resource ( hr ) roles at its stores .
a further 600 will go from group hr and includes roles at sainsbury 's , argos and sainsbury 's bank .
earlier this year , sainsbury 's axed 400 in store jobs as part of a shake up of night shift work .

documents.title: tackling the burden of debt
text: how do you solve a problem like debt ?
your questions answered
reset

documents.title: sainsbury 's : market is changing at a rapid pace
text: sainsbury says the job cuts move follows a consultation with staff .
it says the restructuring will affect roles in stores , as well as in hr and payroll departments in manchester , coventry , edinburgh and london .

a sainsbury 's spokesperson said : `` the uk grocery market is changing at a rapid pace and it 's crucial that we transform the way we operate to meet future challenges and continue to provide customers with best in class service . ''

documents.title: sainsbury cuts up to 2,000 jobs
text: sainsbury says it is cutting up to 2,000 jobs in its human resources and central support departments .

the supermarket said : following a comprehensive review , we are proposing some updates to our hr structures and systems , as well as changes to a number of other support roles , subject to consultation .
this has been a difficult decision and we appreciate that this will be a tough time for those colleagues affected by the changes .
we will support them in any way we can . ''

documents.title: google dumps calorie counter
text: google has decided to remove an update to maps that shows users how many calories they would burn if they walked to their destination .
it follows what the search giant described as `` strong user feedback '' with many criticising the feature as patronising , shaming and a possible trigger for eating disorders .
read the full story here .

documents.title: trump set to name new us fed chair
text: us president donald trump is likely to name his for chair of the us federal reserve in early november , according to reuters .
candidates are understood to include the current chair janet yellen , gary cohn , the director of the national economic council and chief economic advisor to president donald trump .
also in the running are john taylor , professor of economics at stanford university and former fed governor kevin warsh .
reuters reports that mr trump will announce his choice before leaving for a trip to asia next month .

documents.title: watch : the best of both worlds
text: people are increasingly at home with digital shopping and value its convenience , speed , low prices and responsiveness to their preferences .

but because many people still love to go to physical shops too , retailers , both on and offline , are realising that the answer lies in working out how to offer the best of both the physical and digital worlds .

documents.title: london markets close down
text: the ftse 100 closed 10.80 points lower at 7,516.17 on tuesday .
education group pearson led the index , up 7.56 % to 668.5p after publishing an upbeat outlook on full-year figures .
legoland-owner merlin entertainment was the biggest faller , down 15.39 % at 380.5p after it said terrorist attacks had hurt tourism figures .
the ftse 250 fell 86.18 points to 20,130.95 .

documents.title: newcastle to go turkish ?
text: newcastle united football club could end up in turkish hands , according to the london evening standard .
it reports that billionaire murat ülker is the frontrunner to buy the club which has been put up for sale by mike ashley , the majority owner of the sports direct retail chain .
mr ülker is the chairman of yıldız holding , a huge global food business that boasts brands such as jaffa cakes and godiva chocolate .

documents.title: unitedhealth powers market rise
text: unitedhealth propelled the dow jones industrial average to its new high after the health insurer beat third year forecasts and upgraded full-year profit expectations .
its share price is up 5.16 % at $ 203.08 .
commenting in the market , andre bakhos , managing director at janlyn capital says : `` the market seems like it 's in a holding pattern as investors look for additional evidence to drive it higher .
`` as we get into the meat of earnings season , investors are looking to confirm the valuations of equities . ''

documents.title: breakingdow jones reaches 23,000
text: the dow jones industrial average has reached 23,000 for the first time .
it is trading up 43.19 points at 23,000.15 .

documents.title: fancy farewell prompts probe
text: on leaving a job , people might bring in cake for the office or maybe go for a pint .
not so at air berlin .
in a unique way of saying goodbye , a pilot did a fly-past to mark the insolvent airline 's last long-haul flight at duesseldorf airport .
according to german newspaper tagesspiegel , the aircraft received a water salute when the airport fire brigade ceremonially sprayed the plane with plumes of water .
unfortunately , the federal aviation office is now examining the incident .

documents.title: tillman gets groovythe telegraph 's retail editor ashley armstrong tweets
text: harold tillman secures £ 12.5m for his rescue of jacques vert .
the release calls it `` shoreditch-based '' , but its age demographic really ai n't

documents.title: good for bombardier , great for airbus
text: a neat solution to a thorny trade dispute .
a deal which sees airbus take a majority stake in bombardier 's c-series plane achieves a number of objectives .
first , it means they can be assembled inside the us - potentially avoiding the crippling 300 % tariff the us government wants to see imposed on each plane .

second , it gives the aircraft the benefit of the global sales and muscle plus the all-round credibility of airbus - particularly in the asian market where interest in a plane well suited to that market has so far been low .
finally , it safeguards jobs in canada and the uk for now - winning valuable points for politicians in ottawa , belfast and westminster .
if it looks like a good deal for bombardier , it looks like a great deal for airbus .
read more here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: unite welcomes airbus bombardier tie-up
text: davy thompson , regional coordinating officer for the unite union has given the thumbs up to the defensive move from bombardier to join forces with airbus .
unite says it has been assured the deal will guarantee jobs there .
he says the deal `` has the potential to open the door to new markets and ensure long-term sustainability of c series production '' .

unite will continue our efforts to ensure the withdrawal of the us tariffs on the c series but this is a welcome development - one that gives 'breathing space ' to the c series itself and which we anticipate should safeguard the future of c series production jobs in belfast for the foreseeable future . ''

documents.title: a lone dove
text: the pound is trading 0.55 % down on the dollar at $ 1.31780 .
it is off 0.12 % on the euro at €1.12200 .
the market is shaken by comments from the bank of england deputy governor sir dave ramsden .
however , the newest member of the bank 's monetary policy committee appears to be its only dove .
in other words , a rate rise in november still looks likely .
here 's how barclays sees the vote going next month :

documents.title: trump tumbles on rich list
text: forbes has released its 2017 billionaires list and while it is no surprise to see microsoft co-founder and philanthropist bill gates in the number one slot again , a certain donald j. trump might not be so happy .
forbes calculates that the us president has fallen to 248th place from last year 's 156th place .
the former real estate investor has seen his wealth fall by $ 600m to $ 3.1bn .
conversely , amazon founder jeff bezos has had a cracking year .
the entrepreneur , who also owns the washington post and has been the target of a twitter tirade by mr trump , saw his fortune rise to $ 86bn from $ 75bn
this propelled him into the top three on forbes ' list for the first time .

documents.title: dow jones hits new high
text: can the dow jones industrial average hit 23,000 ?
it is certainly heading that way after opening 18.71 points higher at a new high of 22,975.67 .
the s & p 500 is marginally ahead at 2,558.05 but the nasdaq fell back 1.68 points to 6,622.32 .

documents.title: how much is your house worth ?
text: would you like to know how much your house has risen or fallen in value ?
look no further .
the bbc has a spiffy new graphic that can answer that very question .
but be warned - clicking on this link could either make or break your day .

documents.title: q & a : bombardier-airbus deal
text: q & a : bombardier-airbus deal
author: Julian O'Neill
BBC News NI Business Correspondent

documents.title: fca agrees to scrutiny of rbs report
text: the financial conduct authority has agreed to the treasury committee 's proposal for andrew green qc to study its report into misconduct at rbs .
fca chief executive andrew bailey has told committee chair nicky morgan he consents to allow mr green to compare its summary with the full report .
the fca has refused to publish the skilled persons ' report .
last week ms morgan said her committee may force publication if the fca did not agree to it being scrutinised .

documents.title: pearson shares get boost but results a mixed bag
text: shares in publisher pearson are up nearly 8 % after it narrowed its expected profit range to the upper end of previous guidance .
but nicholas hyett , an equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown says : `` in some ways it 's a rather mixed set of results .
`` on the one hand profit expectations have been narrowed - reflecting a revenue performance in line with management expectations and lower costs .
on the other , sales continue to fall , particularly in the us , and current headwinds are expected to continue into the medium-term .
however , these are positive results for pearson overall . ''

documents.title: goldman sachs revenues rise
text: goldman sachs has reported revenue of $ 8.33bn ( £ 6.3bn ) for the third quarter , beating many market expectations .

the company did have a 26 % drop on bond trading , but chairman and chief executive lloyd blankfein ( says : `` our overall performance this year has been solid and provides a good foundation on which to execute and deliver our growth initiatives , ''

documents.title: curate 's egg : why merlin is good in parts
text: merlin 's shares are still down more than 18 % today , following a disappointing briefing on their results so far this year .
but steve clayton at hargreaves lansdown , who manages a fund which holds merlin shares says parts of it are their fault , parts are out of their hands :
tourism businesses always have to contend with the weather , but terrorism is unfortunately becoming an increasing , additional headwind .
`` merlin have some issues of their own too , and their midway brands are under-performing more broadly .
but the group is still growing , reflecting the roll-out of new legolands and more hotel room openings at their parks .
he adds : `` overall , merlin is something of a curate 's egg at the moment and the group will need to work hard to keep the numbers moving in the right direction . ''

documents.title: pound down
text: the pound is 0.42 % lower against the dollar at $ 1.3196 .
sterling initially rose after this morning 's inflation report suggested a rate rise might now be more likely .
but then comments from sir dave ramsden the bank of england 's new deputy governor , raised doubts .
the deputy governor said he was not close to voting for an interest rate hike because he saw little sign of inflation pressure building in britain 's labour market .
`` despite continued robust growth in employment there is no sign of second-round effects onto wages from higher recent inflation , '' he told the treasury select committee .

documents.title: fluctuations fail to move ftse
text: a quick lunchtime check on the london share market :
it has been a busy day with some sharp price movements in merlin and pearson .
but overall the ftse index is only 0.22 % higher than its opening level .
the ftse 250 is 0.35 % lower at 20,146 .

documents.title: higher inflation 'means more pain for households '
text: current government policy is to freeze most working age benefits until 2020 , says the institute for fiscal studies , meaning that `` higher inflation means more pain for households '' .

`` combined with the latest inflation forecasts , today 's number means that the four-year freeze is now expected to reduce entitlements in 2019-20 by an average of £ 450 per year for the 10.5 million households affected - saving the exchequer £ 4.6bn . ''

documents.title: what does mark carney think of a post-brexit transition period ?
text: at the treasury select committee mark carney has been asked for his thoughts on the length of any post-brexit transition period .
he says it is in the interests of the eu 27 to have a transition period and `` given the scale and complexity of the issues '' he expects that there will ultimately be a transition .
`` there 's a very limited amount of time between now and march 2019 to transition large , complex financial institutions and activities , '' he said .
he says for an individual firm to integrate various risk and derivative activities from an outside jurisdiction into the uk tends to takes two to four years .
with brexit we 're talking about a substantial proportion of the activity in london so common sense would suggest some kind of transition period .

documents.title: morgan stanley profit rises despite trading slump
text: morgan stanley has reported a rise in net income for the third quarter as the performance in its investment banking and wealth management businesses more than offset a slowdown in trading .
profit rose to $ 1.8bn ( £ 1.3bn ) from $ 1.6bn in the same period the year .
revenue rose to $ 9.2bn compared to $ 8.9bn .

documents.title: uber european policy chief quits
text: uber 's european policy chief christopher burghardt is to jump ship to join the electric vehicle charging network company chargepoint , the latest senior figure to leave the ride-hailing firm .
the bbc understands mr burghardt left to pursue a career opportunity .

documents.title: brexit reversal 'would kickstart uk economy ' says oecd
text: a second referendum that reverses brexit would have a `` positive '' and `` significant '' impact on the uk economy , which is on track to be crippled by its eu divorce , an influential think tank says .
the latest uk economic survey by the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) projects economic growth of just 1 % in 2018 .
it says the uncertainty of brexit negotiations is likely to leave the uk without a free-trade agreement with the eu by its official exit date in 2019 .
read more here .

documents.title: carney defends record on pound
text: mark carney at the treasury select committee has just been asked whether he should have raised interest rates last year after the brexit vote in order to support the pound - since it was clear it would fall on the brexit vote .
mr carney says he does n't agree at all .
the weakening of the pound was the judgement the market was making about what would happen to real incomes in the uk , `` that they 'd be lower '' he says .

he says the bank 's role is to support adjustment in the economy to all the changes involved , and that the judgement has to be about balancing the trade-off between getting inflation back to target and giving support to the economy .

documents.title: dear philip
text: so what will mr carney put in his letter to the chancellor next month , if inflation keeps going up ?
`` inflation rising potentially above the 3 % level in the coming months is something that we have anticipated , '' he says .
`` we had signaled in fact prior to the referendum that we felt that the event of a vote to leave , one of the adjustment mechanisms would be through sterling .

`` we expected sterling to fall sharply , it did , that passes through the prices and as a consequence we faced a trade-off , and we still face a trade-off between having inflation above target and the desirability of supporting jobs and activity . ''

documents.title: carney : inflation still to rise
text: bank of england governor mark carney is being questioned by the treasury select committee .
he is asked if the bank doing enough to keep inflation to target , and what will the bank say to the chancellor if inflation goes to 3.1 % or above ?
( mr carney is required to write to the chancellor if inflation hits 3.1 % .
`` i think it 's more likely than not than i will be writing on behalf of the mpc to the chancellor .
we expect inflation will peak around the october/november figures , and so peaking potentially above the 3 % level . ''

documents.title: the long view of inflation
text: according to professor costas milas of the university of liverpool today 's inflation figure looks bad in an historical context .
since 1661 average cpi inflation has been only '' 1.6 % and median cpi inflation only '' 1 % with cpi inflation recording a value of 3 % ( or higher ) on only 37 % of occasions .
to some extent , this casts some doubt on the argument that boe operational independence has been a `` catalyst '' for low inflation post 1997 , he argues .
we like to take a long perspective on occasion , though we do n't often go back 350 years .

documents.title: christmas ringing the tills already
text: more on the supermarket spend figures :
it seems we 're already in festive mood .

kantar says £ 69m of chocolate confectionary boxes were sold in the last four weeks - a near threefold increase on sales in august ; mince pies reached sales of £ 4m and the british public spent £ 1.1m on christmas puddings .
and although the budget supermarkets lidl and aldi have seen strong sales growth , waitrose has pulled ahead of lidl in terms of market share .
apparently in the run up to christmas ( yes , that includes september ) some people decide to trade up for their yuletide fare .

documents.title: inflation by sector
text: inflation by sector

documents.title: what 's happening to real wages ?
text: what 's happening to real wages ?

documents.title: treasury : 'families feeling the effects of inflation '
text: the treasury says it understands that `` families are feeling the effects of inflation '' but says it is helping people deal with the effects .
`` we 've frozen fuel duty , doubled free childcare for nearly 400,000 working parents and cut income tax for 30 million people .
`` increases to the national living wage are also delivering the fastest pay rise for the lowest paid in 20 years . ''
do you feel that the government is helping out enough with childcare costs ?
are national living wage increases helping the economy ?
have your say by contacting us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk .

documents.title: brexit to hit productivity , says ramsden
text: sir dave ramsden , deputy governor for markets and banking at the bank of england , has told the treasury select committee that , at least in the short term , brexit will have a `` negative '' impact on productivity .

he said : `` the august inflation report forecast already projects that business investment , while growing modestly , will be 20 % lower by the end of the forecast period than it would have been if the uk had stayed in the eu .
`` this is at a time when business investment growth is up materially in many other advanced economies and financial conditions are supportive .
`` my concern is that business investment and other factors could have a bigger impact on productivity growth and supply capacity over this period than currently assumed in the forecast . ''

documents.title: 'wolves at the door '
text: some experts have argued that now is not the time to raise interest rates .

but on the flipside although a rates rise could increase mortgage costs , the bank of england must raise interest rates to help tackle the effects of inflation and strengthen the pound , says calum bennie of scottish friendly .
`` mark carney must recognise the wolves are now at the door , '' he says .
`` consumers have been dealt a double blow of poor income growth and rising shop prices over the past year .
`` for many , this has increased dependency on credit , but with defaults now on the rise it 's clear that many families are finding it nigh on impossible to balance the books .
evidently , it 's not a lending hand they need from the bank of england right now , but a savings one . ''

documents.title: 'resist the urge ' to raise rates
text: peter hemington , head of corporate finance at accountancy firm bdo , says despite inflation being at its highest rate for five years the mpc `` must resist the temptation to hike interest rates . ''
his reasoning ?
`` economic growth is uninspiring , consumer spending is struggling and brexit continues to bring great uncertainty for business .
we want to see the bank of england keep its powder dry . ''
the big challenge to the uk economy is low productivity caused by decades of underinvestment .
policymakers need to commit to a huge programme of infrastructure investment and a focus on skills , '' he says .

documents.title: incomes squeeze gets tighter
text: inflation has hit a five year high and is now 0.9 % above the rate of wage growth - meaning that the incomes squeeze is becoming tighter .
and if you are employed in the public sector - where pay rises are capped at 1 % - or rely on benefits - which are frozen - that squeeze is even tighter .
with poor economic growth figures and uncertainty over the brexit process , the bank of england 's decision on whether to raise interest rates next month is finely balanced .
yes , price stability '' is the main purpose of the bank of england 's monetary policy committee , which makes the decision .
but many believe that inflation may now have peaked as the effects of sterling 's depreciation following the referendum dissipate .
an interest rate rise now , which increases prices for millions of mortgage holders and could dampen economic activity , could be just the medicine the economy does n't need .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: business rates hike 'will add to business rates misery '
text: in april , business rates will rise by today 's retail price index inflation figure of 3.9 % .
mike cherry , chairman of the federation of small businesses ( fsb ) , said :
`` today 's rpi figure follows six months of business rates misery for our small business community .
`` since april 's bruising revaluation we 've had the staircase tax , introduction of an unworkable appeals platform and chronic delays to the chancellor 's £ 435m relief package .
`` a near 4 % bill increase next april , on top of losing year one transitional caps , will be the last straw for many . ''

documents.title: `` e business rates rise in the pipeline
text: the inflation figures are particularly bad news for retailers , who will now be facing an `` epic business rates rise '' , says richard lim , chief executive of retail economics .
on the one hand , personal finances are coming under increasing strain from rising food and transport costs which will continue to bear down on discretionary spending .
`` on the other , it sets up the largest rise in business rates in six years , due to be implemented in april next year .
we estimate the retail industry alone will be hit by an additional bill of around £ 300m . ''

documents.title: pound recovers after inflation data dip
text: the pound is up slightly against the dollar at $ 1.3276 after official figures showed cpi inflation at 3 % in september .
it dipped briefly after the uk inflation data came out broadly in line with forecasts .

documents.title: average house prices rise
text: average house prices in the uk increased again in august , official figures show .
in july the increase was 4.5 % and has remained broadly under 5 % during 2017 .
in august :

documents.title: food and transport help push up inflation
text: food and transport helped push up # inflation .
does 3 % give the mpc the license to raise rates in november ?
author: Mark Broad
Online and Today business editor

documents.title: retail price index inflation at 3.9 %
text: the rate of retail price index inflation , which is used to set business rates next year , was 3.9 % in september , the office for national statistics said .

documents.title: breakinguk inflation rate rises to 3 % in september
text: the uk 's inflation rate climbed to its highest in more than five years in september .
uk inflation measured by the consumer prices index rose to 3 % in september , up from 2.9 % in august , official figures show .

documents.title: supermarkets sweep up spending increase
text: supermarket sales are up 3.1 % compared with last year according to the latest grocery market share figures from kantar worldpanel .
perhaps that 's not surprising .
prices have been rising , and we all do still need to eat .
so we spend a little more on our weekly shop .
kantar says `` each of the big four has grown sales but seen a decrease in market share as smaller operators continue to entice new customers through their doors '' .
morrisons was the fastest growing of the large supermarkets .
however , the retailer 's overall market share fell by 0.1 percentage points to 10.3 % .
at tesco , sales grew by 2.1 % though share was down 0.3 percentage points to 27.9 % .
asda saw sales up 1.8 % in the past 12 weeks .
sales at sainsbury 's increased 1.9 % on last year while market share now stands at 15.8 % , down 0.2 percentage points .

documents.title: merlin shares crash 20 %
text: investors are n't impressed by peppa pig .
shares in merlin entertainments have dropped over 20 % after this morning 's trading update which showed flat like-for-like sales .
the company 's blaming terrorist incidents and the weather .

documents.title: hornby warns on profits again
text: it 's all change at hornby again after the model train maker said there will be a `` material impact '' on profits for the year .
it said in september its performance in the year to date had been below expectations .

this , coupled with a new strategy of no longer offering large quantities of stock at a discount , brought in by new chief executive lyndon davies , mean `` the shortfall is unlikely to be recouped in the current year , '' it said .
interim chairman david adams is to step down from the board to take up another appointment .

documents.title: asian markets edge higher again
text: asian stocks were relatively subdued on tuesday , but again inched slightly higher , pushing further into record territory .
korea 's kospi edged higher , while japan 's nikkei continuing its ten day winning streak , climbing 0.34 % to 21,328.46 .
hong kong 's hang seng climbed 0.12 % to 28726.78 , while australia 's asx gained 0.73 to close at 5,889.60 .

documents.title: merlin 's magic
text: merlin 's recent new offerings , including legoland japan , have boosted business over the 40 weeks to 7 october , with revenues up 12.4 % .
but like-for-like growth for the group was only 0.3 % .
the firm is blaming `` the series of terror attacks and unfavourable weather '' especially in europe for the lack of growth .
they 'll be hoping that legoland new york - expected to open in 2020 - will be able to work some magic on future revenues .
in the meantime it 's up to peppa pig to get more visitors through the gates at existing sites .

documents.title: bellway profits get help to buy helping hand
text: in common with many other uk housebuilders , bellway is being given a bit of a leg-up by the government 's ongoing help to buy scheme .
it says profit before tax jumped 12.6 % to £ 560.7m in the year ended 31 july .
help to buy was used in 35 % of its sales , bellway says .

documents.title: grylls and pigsmerlin 's latest recipe
text: trading has been pretty flat for merlin entertainments , which runs legoland , madam tussauds and a range of other attractions , but they have announced a couple of rather intriguing new intellectual property tie-ups .
they 'll be partnering with the tv outdoor survival adventurer bear grylls to offer activities `` targeted at the adventure-based experiences market '' .

and - presumably tough to endure in a whole different way - worldwide visitors to merlin attractions will soon be able to stay in themed accommodation and try new attractions based on uber-popular kids tv brand 'peppa pig ' after a multi-territory agreement with entertainment one .
business staff are already speculating over what `` the bear grylls adventure '' might entail when it opens in birmingham in 2018 .
wrestling with wild animals ?
hunting for your own dinner instead of buying a burger ?

documents.title: as seen in their results
text: asos , as expected , is strutting its stuff with its full year results this morning .
the online fashion retailer ( as seen on screen ) posted revenues 34 % higher than last year , with international sales up 47 % - in line with predictions .
profit before tax is up a whopping 145 % .
chief executive nick beighton puts it down to the `` increasingly strong and differentiated asos proposition .
our new agile technology platform is allowing us to accelerate our pace of innovation with great benefits for our customers . ''

documents.title: government consults on intervention in mergers
text: the uk government is looking into widening its powers to step in to stop mergers .

the department for business , energy and industrial strategy said it wants `` to examine and potentially intervene in mergers that currently fall outside the thresholds in two areas : ( i ) the dual use and military use sector , ( ii ) parts of the advanced technology sector . ''

for these sectors , `` the government proposes to lower the turnover threshold from £ 70m to £ 1m and remove the current requirement for the merger to increase the share of supply to or over 25 % . ''

documents.title: raising expectations
text: dame deanne julius , former member of the bank of england 's monetary policy committee , thinks we are at a `` tipping point '' where it 's appropriate to consider raising interest rates , though she does n't believe a rise is inevitable .
inflation has been on the up , but last month the mpc voted 7-2 against putting up rates so `` to some extent it will be a bit of a surprise if the mpc does raise rates '' she told radio 4 .
but clearly mark carney - who has always said he 's a fan of `` forward guidance '' - is preparing the ground for a rate rise with recent media comments , she says .
you 'd have to forgive the markets for being wary of this guidance though - previously he has n't been able to follow through after expectations were raised .
after all he only has one of the votes on the mpc .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: beware the bear
text: bill mcnabb , chairman of us investment fund giant vanguard , has told the today programme that he thinks the markets could be on course for a `` decent-sized correction at some point '' .

but another today guest saker nusseibeh , chief executive of hermes fund managers , suggests that compared to bond valuations the share market is n't overvalued - one way to measure if we 're in bubble territory .
he says a ten percent fall would just be `` blood letting '' allowing the market to get on with things , he says
he also gives us a useful way of thinking about any potential correction in the market : a `` black bear '' is `` not a bad bear '' - that 's a 20 % correction .
but every now and again you do have a brown bear like in 2008 which is a 40 % drop .

documents.title: sour grapes ?
text: boeing has said airbus 's deal with bombardier looks like an attempt to sidestep import duties .
`` this looks like a questionable deal between two heavily state-subsidised competitors to skirt the recent findings of the u.s. government , '' a boeing spokesman said .
`` our position remains that everyone should play by the same rules , for free and fair trade to work . ''
bombardier chief executive alain bellemare told reporters : `` this is a strategic decision .
we 're doing this deal here not because of this boeing petition .
we are doing this deal because it is the right strategic move for bombardier .
and it makes good strategic sense for airbus , '' bellemare said .

bombardier earlier said it would sell control of its cseries programme to europe 's airbus under a deal that would see some of the jets produced in the us , where local airlines would therefore not have to pay proposed import penalties
the huge increase in tariffs will be brought in after a boeing complaint against bombardier .
there are theories that boeing went after bombardier either to try to make it go bust , or to try to take a controlling interest in the cseries programme .

documents.title: inflation at 3 % 'psychologically important '
text: a 3 % rise in prices would be `` uncomfortable '' says victoria clarke at investec , the today programme 's guest looking ahead to inflation figures out later this morning .
but she thinks that could happen this month , thanks to the big drop in sterling which has been passing through to headline inflation since last summer .
she thinks 3 % would be `` a bit of a landmark , psychologically important '' given that it would be the fastest rise in prices since april 2012 .
more importantly 3 % or higher would `` lock in all those steers we 've had pointing to a november rate rise '' .
but bank of england governor mark carney will only have to write to the chancellor explaining himself if it 's 3.1 % or higher .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'the wrong kind of inflation '
text: many economists expect september 's cpi inflation figure to be around 3 % after the devaluation of sterling following the brexit referendum .
saker nusseibeh from hermes investment management says : `` this is an odd kind of inflation .

economists talk about the wrong kind of inflation it 's not inflation because you and i ask for more money to be paid , but actually it 's because the prices of things go up , and so it 's like inflation back in the bad of days of the 70s and early 80s . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: airbus or bust ?
text: european aerospace firm airbus is to take a majority stake in bombardier 's c-series jet project .
bombardier has faced a series of problems over the plane , most recently a trade dispute in the us that imposed a 300 % import tariff after action from boeing .
and airbus and boeing have a long history of trade disputes through the wto .
saker nusseibeh from hermes investment management says :

`` bombardier financially was always weak , that 's why the quebec government had supported it earlier , and the theory was that boeing was going after bombardier actually to make it go bust , because it [ boeing ] did not have a competitor to the new c-plane .
now , airbus knows this , and does not want the competition to go out , and obviously wants the plane . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: all eyes on uk inflation this morning as official figures come out .
uk inflation rose to 2.9 % in august , up from 2.6 % in july .
inflation is outstripping wage growth but the basic state pension is protected by triple lock , and so will get a boost if the rate is above 2.5 % .
some economists think inflation will peak at its highest around 3 % this month .
meanwhile , bombardier is to take a majority stake in bombardier 's c-series project .
